item.description:
This is a workshop designed to introduce the photographer to some basic portrait studio techniques.

This 4 hour (1:00 pm to 5:00 pm) workshop will be a combination of classroom instruction and hands on studio shooting. We will be demonstrating how to use and control a single light for making portraits. Using a single light allows us to describe/demonstrate lighting techniques that can be applied to more complex, multi light sourced studio work. We will also be discussing general studio equipment and techniques.

The concepts covered also can be applied to very basic lighting equipment so that the average photographer who is interested in studio portrait making can get into it with a modest investment.

We will be working with a few live models to provide a more realistic studio experience. Bring your cameras with charged batteries and plenty of memory cards and come ready to do some shooting.

THIS CLASS IS LIMITED IN SIZE and requires payment to confirm your attendance. Payment via PAYPAL does not require that you have a PAYPAL account of your own.
